result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre Darvell Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two. Credit for 703 days.

Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Court costs, victim witness surcharges/other surcharges, DNA surcharge AND restitution: To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  If not paid, will convert to a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Count two.
Count one.

THE FOLLOWING ENTRY IS THE CORRECT SENTENCING LANGUAGE:


AS TO COUNT1 (Disorderly Conduct-while armed): DEFENDANT IS SENTENCED TO NINE (9) MONTHS WITH PENALTY ENHANCER 947.01 (DC) AND 939.63(1)(a). TO BE SERVED CONCURRENT TO COUNT TWO (2).
Defendant to receive 703 days credit.

AS TO COUNT 2 (Felon in possession of firearm): DEFENDANT IS SENTENCED TO SEVEN (7) YEARS; THREE (3) YEARS INITIAL CONFINEMENT, FOUR (4) YEARS EXTENDED SUPERVISION.
Defendant to receive 703 days credit.

Defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $4,925.25 joint and several.

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. IF NOT PAID, WILL CONVERT TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Pay COURT COSTS, VICTIM/WITNESS SURCHARGE/OTHER SURCHARGES; IF NOT PAID, WILL CONVERT TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT.
COURT COSTS, FINES, SURCHARGES AND RESTITUTION TO BE PAID THROUGH COLLECTION BY THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS FROM 25% OF FUNDS UNDER SEC. 973.05(4)(b) AND AS A CONDITION OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Andre Darvell Davis in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter in court for Sentencing hearing. Sentencing proceeded. The Court having found the defendant guilty on Counts one (1) and two (2):

IT IS ORDERED AS TO COUNT 1: THE DEFENDANT IS SENTENCED TO NINE (9) YEARS IN THE WISCONSIN STATE PRISON; THREE (3) YEARS INITIAL CONFINEMENT, FOUR (4) YEARS EXTENDED SUPERVISION TO BE SERVED CONCURRENT WITH COUNT 2.

IT IS ORDERED AS TO COUNT 2: THE DEFENDANT IS SENTENCED TO NINE (9) YEARS IN THE WISCONSIN STATE PRISON; THREE (3) YEARS INITIAL CONFINEMENT, FOUR (4) YEARS EXTENDED SUPERVISON TO BE SERVED CONCURRENT WITH COUNT 1. 

Defendant to receive a credit of 703 days.

Defendant to pay RESTITUTION in the amount of $4,925.25.

Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. IF NOT PAID, WILL CONVERT TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Pay COURT COSTS/OTHER SURCHARGES AND RESTITUTION; IF NOT PAID, WILL CONVERT TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT.
COURT COSTS, FINES, SURCHARGES AND RESTITUTION TO BE PAID THROUGH COLLECTION BY THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS FROM 25% OF FUNDS UNDER SEC. 973.05(4)(b) AND AS A CONDITION OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

DEFENDANT IS REMANDED INTO CUSTODY.
The September 12, 2016 Jury Trial is vacated.

Defendant Andre Darvell Davis in court with Attorney Gary Raymond George.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  AS TO COUNTS #1 AND #2:  Defendant waived rights and entered an ALFORD Plea.   Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for an Alford plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms or body armour. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court VACATED the April 18, 2016 Jury Trial.  Matter set for sentencing on June 14, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Defendant Andre Darvell Davis in court with attorney Virginia M. Stuller.  Defendant Andre Darvell Davis in custody.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court on State's motion for joinder and defense's motion for bail modification.

AS TO STATE'S MOTION FOR JOINDER:  Defense objects.  Arguments heard.  Court GRANTS State's motion for joinder and, therefore, case #s 14CF962 and 14CF2712 should be tried together.

AS TO DEFENSE'S MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL:  Bail is currently set at $25,000.00 cash.  Defendant filed a motion to modify bail (PRO SE); also Atty. Stuller filed a motion to modify bail on behalf of the defendant.  Defense's motion to modify bail argued and DENIED.

Defense requests to adjourn the trial date to late October.
No objections.
Court GRANTS request.
